instance.context:
A BOAT that can run swiftly and silently without a churning propeller has been the dream of naval commanders ever since the first submarine slid gurgling
beneath the waves .

This is especially important when an aquifer dips
beneath another layer that is much less permeable .

The ground dropped sharply
beneath us as we bounced off the nearest trunk .

Where Mr Winchester 's cross-Pacific connections become less sure is when they become tangible and man-made : the optical-fibre telephone cable that snakes
beneath the Pacific from California to Hawaii and then branches out to Japan and Guam ; the AsiaSat satellite and its fellow ` birds " , sitting on the equator to bounce across Asia the telephone calls of businessmen and the television dramas of Hollywood ; the new Boeing 747-400 , able to fly non-stop from Sydney to Los Angeles ; and , odd as it seems , the Macintosh computer .

She was eventually deposited , within a new coffin ,
beneath the altar-slab in her husband 's chantry chapel in the Abbey in 1878 .

It is only by placing the new station
beneath the existing one that all the required rail connections can be made .

Reaching for a napkin , Ashley tucked it
beneath Thomas 's chin .

And that night when Linnet , face to face with her own reflection in her solitary looking-glass and the stark realization of how much it had really meant to her , had been unable to sleep Tristan had walked with her for hours in the manor garden , Gemma watching them from her bedroom window as they paced
beneath the chestnut trees , engrossed , almost entwined , like turning to like , intent wholly and exclusively upon one another .

What was the hold he exerted over her , that could steal
beneath her guard and leave her so vulnerable to his own undeniable brand of charm ?

Stripping off the rest of her wet clothes , she bundled them out on the landing , then irritably turned on the shower and stepped
beneath the hot jets .

He was young , his blond hair straggling
beneath an enormous cap , his stout body so stuffed into a French doublet that when he stood up in the stirrups ( to give himself height ) his coat bulged at the seams .

Young lovers strolled quietly
beneath the trees , or sat together on the few wooden benches , daring to snatch the odd , discreet kiss or embrace .

The tuna fish swim
beneath schools of dolphins , fishermen do not discriminate and scoop up the whole lot in their nets .

They swim
beneath the surface with sharp black fins , waiting to attack .

They are searching the flat methodically , opening cushions , moving furniture , looking
beneath the floor .

We huddle
beneath the covers , but to our dismay , the one duvet is but a slim pink layer of fabric resembling a furniture cover .

She was still trembling half an hour later , as she huddled
beneath a small gateway , trying to keep her footing on the wet grass of the embankment .

His arm was hurting
beneath its bandage .

The dead priest 's body still sprawled
beneath his sheet in that small white room .

Sugar grains crunched and gritted on the table
beneath it .

As she stepped , slivers of glass cracked and crunched
beneath her feet .

More glass covered the road ; she heard it crunching
beneath the tyres .
Beneath the boards on which the men squatted the matter froze hard and solid .

She jumped back in surprise as she felt his fingers
beneath hers , twined around the handle .

I can feel again
beneath my fingers the vigorous resentment of the caterpillar , the wet , leathery hydrangea leaves , and my mother 's little work-worn hand .

He found his belly seething and bubbling with movements he could feel quite clearly
beneath his hands .

Charsky heard a strange rustling sound
beneath him .

Only in Trnopolje and Omarska , they felt , were they beginning to see the truth
beneath the facade of propaganda .

Suddenly Lee saw the exhaustion in the folds of skin
beneath her mother 's eyes .

A string of multi-coloured lights gleamed
beneath the overhanging thatch and bright yellow light was streaming from its tiny windows .

It was as though a white cloak had been thrown over the entire countryside , a cloak which gleamed
beneath an enormous ghostly-white moon , robbing the night of its darkness .

From our campsite the route climbed above the tundra
beneath the mighty rock cliffs of Hongu South Peak , festooned with snow and ice like feathered-icing on some gigantic cake , to the top of a lateral moraine .

We found our torches and entered the caves
beneath the island .

Lindsey leaned forward , her fingers gently probing
beneath the man 's jaw .

There is already evidence that mining corporations are interested in probing
beneath the sedimentary rocks to find new deposits .

Bending double , he ducked
beneath the window and was moving towards the door when a long man-shaped shadow moved across the bar of light thrown out onto the paved pathway .

The noise of splintering wood became more commonplace than the singing of birds as saplings and lesser trees were crushed
beneath the weight of falling forest giants .

Dante 's sinners are buried in mud , shut up in the trunks of trees , frozen solid in blocks of ice , crushed
beneath stones .

It secretes a new , soft wrinkled skin
beneath the shell .

He moved forward , tracing the scar
beneath Chen 's left ear with his forefinger .

The execution stake was now hidden
beneath its wall of flame .

Hens and geese were picking around in two small haystacks and fleets of tiny yellow chickens were half hidden
beneath some planking and under the foundations of some rickety sheds .

For the past 300 years the substantial remains of one of medieval England 's most important fortresses have lain hidden
beneath part of the city centre .

It was the image of a large bulky-looking object shrouded
beneath a groundsheet and secured with baling wire , and it was humming and humming and humming .

The most satisfactory arrangement is to have the cable connector concealed
beneath a small paving slab .

Amazingly she found herself treated to a brief smile as Niall , hair concealed
beneath the operating cap , glanced briefly in her direction before he bent over the unconscious man once more .

The actual knee is concealed
beneath the plumage and is almost contiguous with the body .

Carla gave her attention to a brass bell , a crinoline lady with a clapper of dirty base metal enshrouded
beneath the silly wide skirt .

The slugs obligingly congregate
beneath the citrus dome and can be gathered for disposal .

I huddled down
beneath the parapet .

A waitress shoved a plate of cocktail bits
beneath Joshua 's nose .

What safety they offered was debatable , but if worst came to worst he would throw himself
beneath a car , and deny the voiders the entertainment of his slow demise .

His eyebrows shot up till they almost disappeared
beneath his hairline .

Whatever disappears
beneath the surface can no longer be seen .

` One of the boys was still visible when we arrived but he disappeared
beneath the surface . "

He stumbled then fell on to the track , his scream silenced abruptly as he disappeared
beneath the screeching wheels .

And strew palm branches
beneath the donkey 's hooves .
